message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with ranking evaluation metrics in information retrieval, which is a core topic in the sub-field of Information Retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also proposes a data-driven approach to generate relevance functions, which involves machine learning techniques and can be categorized under the sub-field of Machine Learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper uses news items and their popularity on Twitter, which can be related to Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) and Cybersecurity (cs.CY) respectively. Finally, the paper discusses the performance of the proposed method in comparison to a standard evaluation metric, which can be considered as a form of experimental evaluation and falls under the sub-field of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
